fields.body:
One of our last raids on Mazrigos gave us this kill (or did he fall asleep in the corner???).

Frost got stuck in his shoulderpads while trying to pickpocket the corpse. And as you can see everybody are running away as if they didn't notice it. Try cry for help now :P
fields.title: Mythic Beastlord Darmac down

fields.body:
So after many years we are leaving Mazrigos to pursue new opportunities on Draenor.
It was a hard decision to make and we will be leaveing some of our friends behind, but it was a neccesary step to make in order to get fresh blood and keep the guild going.

Best of luck to everybody staying behind, for everybody else the migration deadline is Sunday 10.5.2015. See you on the other side.
fields.title: Goodbye Mazrigos

fields.body: New server, new start, new goal, new methods. Lots of work to get to this point. Lots of work still remains to be done. This should pay off soon.

fields.body:
Since we are eventually gonna start doing Mythic (when we get a cupple more people on board). Im gonna link some video guides for the first few boses.

Now Oregorger is probably the easiest of the mythic bosses and is basicly unchanged from heroic. There are 2 different ways of doing phase 2. One is more controled with the raid spliting in two and oregorger always going  down a preset path the other is more free for all like the heroic tactic we use but its really more of a personal preference wich one to use. The other change is that we now require 5 interupters for his blackrock barrage sicne he now casts it really fast and each failed interupt means he goes into phase 2 sooner wich is bad.

Option 1: First of the free for all tactic. The raid basicly just stands in the middle section so its really easy to avoid his rolls and we only kill the boxes on the sides when hes far away from that area. You can see that tactic in the video below 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D7HPFu8wyxk

Option 2: The other Tactic is the controled phase 2 with 2 groups wich can be seen in the video below

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_N7grPEMRI

fields.body:
[size]Some of the /wa stuff I have floating around:[/size]
Can add more later or even create something on request.



[b][u]First:[/u][/b]
[url=http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/weakauras-2]Download WeakAuras2 here.[/url]
[url=http://www.icy-veins.com/forums/topic/8128-weakauras-fast-start/]Quick and dirty how-to-guide (can stop reading after "import" ).[/url]

[url=http://sunniersartofwar.com/blog/2014/07/08/how-to-change-the-size-and-positioning-of-a-weak-aura/]How to resize and move imported stuff.[/url]




[b][u]The auras you can import:[/u][/b]

[url=http://pastebin.com/PrCmAZ7f]Oregorger - Blackrock Barrage - Interrupt warning on correct stack+cast[/url]
Helps you reminding when you should interrupt Blackrock Barrage.

Oregorger has 5 stacks of Blackrock Spines.
He removes 1 then starts to cast it on us.
It means if you're 1st to interrupt you are interrupting when he has 4 stacks.
If you're 4th to interrupt you do it when he has 1 stack.
If you're 5th (last) to interrupt you do it when he has zero stacks left.

In WA you set stack count = 4 if you're first to interrupt.
If you're last you deselect the stack count line and select invert on the bottom.
[url=http://i60.tinypic.com/sdocv6.png]Click to see example picture.[/url]


[url=http://pastebin.com/qxYxJVKa]Readycheck, summon, LFG/LFD/LFR proposal/invite/queue pop, invite request by others[/url]
Invites and ready checks can easily be missed when you are alt+tab'ing. Airhorn might wake you up.

[url=http://pastebin.com/pDZfiGcu]Battle res request[/url]
Have you ever died and not noticed you got battle ressed because the window+text is just too similar to when you're dead? This will wake you up (airhorn).

[url=http://pastebin.com/avw9XfVc]Helpful raid buffs from others (HRB)[/url]
All major raidwide cooldowns with sound on what is more important (fox+roar+devo), so you can move while casting when the hunter use Fox too late. Shows the name of who cast it.

[url=http://pastebin.com/khb0WWhs]Tank: Defensive cooldowns (TDC)[/url]
Single target cooldowns others put on you the tank.
With name of the casters and amount of absorb.

[url=http://pastebin.com/2rPKF0Tt]ExternalCDs[/url]
(Copied from [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/wow/comments/2xaww4/i_created_a_weakaura_to_track_raid_cooldowns_and/]here[/url].)
Track the dmg red cds that others can give you (as tank).

[url=http://pastebin.com/Z5P0PBtW]Blackrock Foundry - Debuffs and warnings[/url]
Grouped up. You might have copied parts of it already -> delete.

[url=http://pastebin.com/cTduZGC9]Highmaul - Debuffs and warnings[/url]

[url=http://pastebin.com/06fzEx2P]1. In raid and in g1-4 (Enter Blackrock Foundry) (Mythic)[/url]
[url=http://pastebin.com/mFbFvSCL]1. In raid but NOT in g1-4 (Exit Blackrock Foundry, you're on STANDBY) (Mythic)[/url]
If we happen to be too many for mythic some of us will be on standby but maybe still in the raid. Those ppl are then moved to group 5++. This will tell you if you have to HS out or get in without the raid leader telling you to. (This is usually more relevant on farm when we switch per boss because of targetted looting.)

[url=http://pastebin.com/uSESgmWf]0. Auto-delete specific items (no delete confirmation)[/url]
Have you ever been tired of manually deleting those shitty items when mining in the garrison?

[url=http://pastebin.com/ir8bLMcF]0. CombatLogging (change when&where in custom trigger1)[/url]
Auto-enables combatlogging when you are in raid + Blackrock Foundry + difficulty lvl is normal/heroic/mythic. It even reenables if you travel to Washington DC. Auto-disables combatlogging when you leave raid or any other criterias aren't met.

[url=http://pastebin.com/7fZ2Lrvn]0. Readycheck = DeathNote:Reset[/url]
If you're one of those who use /dn and get confused when it shows deaths from multiple tries.

[url=http://pastebin.com/jrxpRBh4]0. Trade chat spam[/url]
Trade/general/lfg chat is so spammy on high pop servers you can't even read /g or /ra before it's gone (if you ever saw something was written). Make a new chat window for trade+general+lfg so you can go there if you wanna read that crap. You can add/remove servers in the custom trigger.

[url=http://pastebin.com/a0N0n7sY]2. Combat time - timer[/url]
Timer addon made inside WeakAuras (you have to /reload UI to enable it, same if you choose load:never).
Can add/subtract time with scrollwheel or mousebuttons, make it start at zero or predetermined time, counting up or down, even start automatically upon entering combat.
Left mouse button on border for moving, right mouse button on border for resizing. Click the red/green button at bottom right for lock/unlock move/resize.
I should probably add a way to hide it by command or minimize it. Some day in the future...



[b][u]Leg ring and trinkets etc:[/u][/b]

[url=http://pastebin.com/1b7ZTSwu]Legendary ring proc[/url]
The progress bar for when the buff is up.
[url=http://pastebin.com/awgKunZv]Legendary ring proc - time since last proc[/url]
When the ring procs this number counts down from ICD (55s) to zero seconds with white text.
[url=http://pastebin.com/M26L4cWz]Legendary ring proc - time since last proc - past ICD[/url]
When the white number has reached zero it goes away, and this red number starts counting upwards with red text (until the ring procs again). Higher red number means increasingly higher chance for the ring to proc very soon (TM). On fights less than 6 mins you want to track as many of these ICDs as possible, so you can delay the use of the 3 min dps cd for when you have multiple procs up at the same time (or they are coming very soon). (Still: don't fool yourself on 7 min fights.)

[url=http://pastebin.com/tKYU0s2e]Trinket - Darmac's Unstable Talisman[/url]
[url=http://pastebin.com/GpTkdBe7]Trinket - Shards of Nothing[/url]
[url=http://pastebin.com/d2n8z0wn]Trinket - Blackiron Micro Crucible[/url]

[url=http://pastebin.com/KT2wSU4y]Lava Burst cast time[/url]
Now that we have all these haste buffs that come on use or with ICD there is a high chance we will get less than 1s cast time for our spammy spell. This tracks the cast time. Change the spell name in the custom display.


[b][u]Edit:[/u][/b]
8/5 Added "Oregorger - Blackrock Barrage - Interrupt warning on correct stack+cast".
11/5 "Combat time - timer": Fixed it once and for all. Will now load and do and save the char profiles correctly.

fields.body:
I'll just leave my mixed opinions.

First of all, on which kind of scale are we migrating? Full scale? If full I'd liquidise all my investments in this realm and then move in a foreseeable future with as much as gold as I can bolster and not to mention save some IRL cash.

Unfortunately this year things been real hectic and I couldnt make it to raids very often however raid days dont really matter to me.

Thats all.

Becker.

fields.body: I have a 90 level boost, wich i can`t use it on Mazrigos since my Charr list is full.That being said i am not saying i will have the energy to level it 100.Do all garrison things again dungeons, lower tier rading to get gear again.But perhaps i`ll come and look you up maybe join a guild as social.You have to understand i wolk i raided with DK,hunter,Priest(disc,shadow) and druid was tank and kitty.Then in CATA i raided with Hunter,Mage,Priest(holy,shadow),Druid(kitty only),Shammy i`ve gotten ower doose with rading i remember rading with 3 charrs heroic Firelands with Bumzee,Poosie and other high level crew they cleared HC Firelands so fast they needed people for alt rading and that was enough for me rading 4 times a week also in weekends.Then dragon soul came out radided only with mage also heroics the instace WAS not appealing to me, FIRELANDS were amazing to much for me and i saw such Trash mechanics implementing in DS heroics.Stopped rading and quited wow.Skipped MOP all together.So my energy level to miggrate or level again is low despite having an instant level 90 on any server.Let`s wait and see what happens a little more.Then you decide on oyur faiths to miggrate or not.

fields.body:
We have created a new guild on Draenor today with the same name as on Mazrigos. The old one will stay untouched where it is. When we need/want to show off our old achievements we can point over to Mazrigos.

This also means you can come earlier if you want. Rapiu+Frost+Bishi have chars in the new Draenor guild.





[u][b]Before transfering:[/b][/u]

For you personally when you transfer your char you will bring everything over. Everything in your bank, bags and voidstorage. Your mailbox and auction house(s) have to be empty though. You'll get an error if there is something in them.

Max gold you can bring over with your char is 50 000 g. There are several tricks to move more "gold" over, but I don't wanna write anything official here in case Blizz have fixed it or removed some options. Ask around in the guild and ask others for confirmation if you'd like. But for the old ways to move gold over is [url=http://www.wowhead.com/item=65891/vial-of-the-sands]Vial of the sands[/url]' or moving a guild over by yourself.

If you choose to move a guild over you must keep in mind that you have to be guild master for 7 days on the char you want to move before the system even starts to think about it. But then the gold cap is ... gold cap: 1 mill gold minus 1 b.

Remember to move crafting mats, flasks, pots and other shit you want with you from your alts to your transfer char.


Char transfer = 20 euro
GM+gbank transfer = 30 euro





[b][u]After transferring:[/u][/b]

All addons will now think that you have created a new char on a new server. If an addon use profiles the profile will now be empty.

For all other addons you can trick them by copy a folder:

Open fileexplorer to:
[list]
\World of Warcraft\WTF\Account\%accountname%\Mazrigos\%yourcharname%
[/list]
copy everything there and paste them in:
[list]
Draenor\%stillthesamecharname%
[/list]

The macros are saved on the server and refuse to read from the local file. Instead of trying to force WoW to read the the macro file you can rather:
[list=1]
[*] Open:
\World of Warcraft\WTF\Account\%accountname%\Mazrigos\%yourcharname%\macros-cache.txt
[*] Log in to your char.
[*] Create a new macro.
[*] Copy the macro text from Notepad and paste in the WoW macro.
[*] Repeat for all macros.
[/list]


[u]Example from Notepad:[/u]
VER 3 0100000000000002 "Capacitor totem" "INV_Misc_QuestionMark"
#showtooltip capacitor totem
/cast [mod:ctrl] totemic projection
/cast capacitor totem
END

[u]Copy the 3 lines;[/u]
#showtooltip capacitor totem
/cast [mod:ctrl] totemic projection
/cast capacitor totem

Paste them in the WoW macro.


The account wide macros are untouched.


Addons that use profiles usually set the profile for each char as charname-servername. It means that your old profiles are named yourcharname-Mazrigos. When you have moved to the new server you can copy the profiles over to yourcharname-Draenor.

For addons like AllPlayed you might have to delete or ignore the Mazrigos char.

If you use TradeSkillMaster to easier mail shit around you have to check your mailto chars, ignore chars and ignore server settings.

Weakauras doesn't operate with servers (realm) unless you manually pick them under Load or write in custom trigger/display.

ElvUI doesn't save all settings in the profile; like bag+skin+unit settings.

fields.body:
Although I am not part of the raiding team, I am also not too content with what's going on on our server. 

I still have to do my research on what migrating to a more populated server brings me. Will I be able to send stuff from my alt character on Mazrigos to Draenor? And is there a seperate auction house? Gotta check Draenor itself out.

So if I get it right, for 20€, all I can transfer is one character, right? There's no way to like buy a package to transfer more characters for a lower price? xD


All in all, I think I' be ready to move to Draenor with you, provided I can keep my social spot in the guild. I can safely say the same for Sanyoor. Perhaps I'll even join the raiding team, but that's gonna be when school's out for summer. Provided the raiding times would be normal, I'd be happy to join the team with my pally. He'll probably be around 680 by then anyway, so there'll only be a small step to make. Also, same for Sanyoor.

Can only mail heirlooms between servers, although it isn't needed now with the heirloom window.

There is 1 auction house for each server or connected servers (like Mazrigos+Lightbringer).

20 euro for 1 char. No package deal.

And yes, you can keep your social spot. More ppl = more fun, no matter which rank they are in.

Draenor also opens up for many more options that we can't even dream about on Mazrigos. Big servers truly go by
more ppl = more fun

fields.body:
Didn't notice one thing before and that is that Draenor is also a PVP server. Since I remember how brilliant world pvp was on Daggerspine while it was still alive, I kind of wish to also get that in the package. Therefore, I might also consider an option of migrating to another server. If so, our paths will split. I must say I am not too happy about it, as I happened to make some good buddies I ocassionally talk to in the guild and because everyone seemed to be quite helpful, but still there are two minuses to it.

If I happen to move to a pvp server, does anyone know of a decent Slo-only horde guild on a high pop pvp server? I know it's kind of a dream, but...

fields.body:
I just transferred an alt from Kazzak to Draenor and I can confirm that buying garrison blueprints and heirloom upgrades on Kazzak and then sell them back to the same vendor on Draenor works. AND you don't lose any money. You get back 100% of the purchase value.


Blueprints lvl 3 cost 1000g but are UNIQUE. So can't fill your bags+bank with 1 type.

[url=http://www.wowhead.com/item=122341/timeworn-heirloom-scabbard]Timeworn heirloom scabbard[/url] costs 5000g and you can buy as many as you want. Only drawback is they don't stack, so 1 bagslot = 1 item = 5000g. But if you clean up your bank+bags and have 50 slots free you can transport 250 000g this way + the 50 000g gold coin limit.

fields.body:
More UI settings to check:

Blizz orig settings.
Worth mentioning:

Controls -> auto luut

Combat -> (dont) show spell alerts

Raid profiles -> select all, then delesect "horizontal groups", "display pets", "display border", "display only dispellable buffs"

(Don't forget to check ElvUI UnitFrames and deselect "party frames" and "raid frames", and go to unitframes -> tank frames and disable it.)

Camera -> max camera distance = far

and use a macro like this to get even further camera distance:

/script SetCVar ("cameraDistancemaxFactor" ,1)
/script SetCVar ("cameraDistancemax" ,50)

fields.body:
[b]Greetings![/b]

You have chosen to apply to Vin la Cvicek and have been /ginvited and accepted for trial. Before we go on and raid together there is something we want you to read and do first.





[b][size=6]Your expectations to us[/size][/b]

By accepting this /ginvite you have also accepted the following rules and statements:

Raiding with us is optional. There is no rule in the universe that says you HAVE TO raid with us. You are here because you want to.

But since we are a group of real people who spend real time and real energy on this we need some rules so this group effort goes more smoothly. If we don't live up to your expectations you are free to leave at any moment, even if passed trial. It's your choice.

The calendar is filled with future raids. Since we all like to plan ahead of time we accept or decline to what our schedule looks like. Having to decline a raid day happens. We all got some special events some times a year. If you find your IRL time doesn't strerch far enough to come raid for a certain day or week you decline the calendar events and tell the officers for how long. If you later find out this has to become permanent we have a slacker rank for just this purpose. 

You can still be in the guild without having to raid. It's optional after all.



[b][size=6]Our expectations to you[/size][/b]

We recently migrated to this server to have an easier time recruiting and then finally get the progression we have planned for so long. We have done big changes within the guild to push us further towards our goal, and we will continue to make changes when we see they will give us an advantage. Now with recruitment we have lots of new ppl, and we all have to adjust to eachothers. So as you can see there is lots happening at once.

We are in essence recreating the guild but without losing our old values.

Because of this the guild will be changing and progressing in another rate in 2 months than it does today. What you see today won't be the case in the future. We will be constantly improving and trying out different ppl to see who fits progression better. How fast and how far we will get depends on what each of us are doing, and how hard each of us are pushing.

This is where you come into the picture.

When we are close to downing a new mythic boss there is so little extra that is needed from it to go from a wipe to a kill. If we wipe a whole day on a boss the officers then sit down and analyze what went wrong and what can be done better. If you happen to not do your best because "that other guy is slacking so I won't bother to push my max either" then it will look to us as you are a slacker too. We will end up replacing two instead of one.

Same goes for when we have farmed a tier for weeks and months and then get a new raid tier on our hands. We will pick those we know will perform well and consistently. Rest will get some fun too, but they have to wait until the bosses are on farm mode.

Anyone who makes drama will get the same treatment, but they might get it faster or even demoted. We do not want any kind of drama in this guild. Not even lootwhoring drama! We are gearing up the group so the group can progress further faster, and that means some will get more gear faster than others.

That's life.

The officers have a set rulebook for who gets loot in which order. If you don't agree you might not fit in with us.


Some last points:
[list]
[*] Don't die > do everything right > good numbers >>>>> bad numbers
[*] Perform average or better compared to the raid group to keep your raid spot, and continue to find ways to improve.
[*] If there are more of your class+spec in the guild then only the best will be picked.
[*] Class stacking might happen too.
[*] We can help you out if you ask, but we can't help if you don't know what to ask for.
[*] Treat the in-game calendar as your IRL work schedule. The consequences are the same.
[*] Same goes for how you treat others.
[*] Ask on TeamSpeak/Mumble if you need info/refreshment on specific fight elements.
[*] If each and every one of us give a little extra to the group the group will grow pretty fast.
[*] DPS-whoring on wrong targets at crucial moments will result in a kick if you don't improve. If you whore like that you single-handedly wipe the group. All by yourself. Gz on that achievement!
[*] If you disagree with some decisions during raids you still do what you are told to. We can discuss it later if we are in combat. Maybe we were wrong. Maybe you were wrong. But for this group to function we need all to do their jobs, couse it's almost impossible to analyze what went wrong if everybody did what they randomly wanted to.
[*] This guild care about solutions. All problems and "problems" will be solved in one way or the other. Or the third.
[/list]



[b][size=6]Raiding days+hours[/size][/b]

TBD.

Be online on the correct character ready for invite and at the instance portal 10 minutes before the calendar says the raid will start. We will start clearing trash immediately.



[b][size=6]Mandatory addons[/size][/b]

[url=http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/calendarnotify]CalendarNotify[/url]
CalendarNotify pops up a window every time a new calendar event invite has been created. It also gives a reminder about today's events when you log in (and /reload). Missing calendar invites with this addon is impossible.


[url=http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/rclootcouncil]RCLootCouncil[/url]
RCLootCouncilmakes lootdistribution 100x more easy for both the masterlooter+lootcouncil+those who want loot. You can only get loot from main raids through this addon.

No addon = no loot.


[url=http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/weakauras-2]WeakAuras 2[/url]
What we require through WeakAuras is to copy our raid boss warnings and other raid tools. Building help for other spell and cooldown is option, although we highly encourage it since it can give anywhere between 10-50% dps increase.

If you haven't used WA before and want to try build helping tools we suggest you watch some basic guides first and try recreate what they showed there. After that try google/twitch up some solutions you might wanna try out. Then we can start become helpful, since now you are more aware about what you want.


[url=http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/big-wigs]BigWigs Bossmods[/url]
Earlier there was only DBM. Now it's only BW, but somehow DBM is still around in some ppl's UI folder. BW is far superior in all ways, and the raid leaders get a much easier time when using it. But if someone use DBM there will always be compability problems around patch and upgrade days, and the raid as a whole wastes lots of time every time the DBM'ers have to fiddle with it.



[b][size=6]Mandatory WAs[/size][/b]

Instance dependant. Ask for links in raid chat to easily copy them

Yu can also find something useful here:
[url=http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topic/36/]http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topic/36/[/url]



[b][size=6]Communication[/size][/b]

Only english and piratespeak in guild chat, raid chat and raid channel on TeamSpeak/Mumble. We even accept weird and bad accents.

For raids we use TeamSpeak and microphones.
[url=http://www.teamspeak.com/?page=downloads]http://www.teamspeak.com/?page=downloads[/url]
85.236.109.225:10187


We also have Mumble as backup.
[url=http://www.mumble.com/mumble-download.php]http://www.mumble.com/mumble-download.php[/url]
sky.siol.net
64646

Set up both TS and Mumble just in case, and calibrate microphone in both.



[b][size=6]Consumables[/size][/b]

Healing tonic.
Do NOT ask for healthstones. It won't heal enough on mythic.

Only best flask, best food and augment runes on progress bosses we are done training on. 2% wipes can be avoided that way.



[b][size=6]Calendar[/size][/b]

You already use the CalendarNotify addon and get notified when the officers create new calendar events which you get invited to.

Always answer all of them, and do it asap. The addon will continue to remind you every time you log in and reload UI until you have. If you are unsure for all raids 2 months into the future you can accept them all and change to decline when you know you won't make it. Tentative is awesome for personal use, but for the raid leader it means the same as decline. Never use tentative to hint that you are coming. Talk to the raid leader or officers instead.

You can also reply to this thread outside the game about your planned AFK:
[url=http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topic/43/]http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topic/43/[/url]

The raid leader needs to plan who to take for each raid, and also in well time before the actual raid day. If you accepted but didn't show up, and also didn't tell the officers in another way, you eventually end up in the (un)unreliable bin.



[b][size=6]Breaks, afk and brb during raids[/size][/b]

We will have one 10 min break when we have raided for about 2h.

If you need an emergency brb for bathroom or similar do your best to do it right after the boss is dead so you are back with time to spare before we start on the next boss.

And remember: it's called EMERGENCY. A person who is slacking after bosses is wasting time and energy for the rest of the group, and we will eventually have to replace that person so it won't demoralize the group.



[b][size=6]Looting[/size][/b]

Looting can be done across the whole raid instance. There is absolutely no reason to wait at the dead boss for the loot.

Click the correct loot option in the RCLootCouncil window that pops up and start clear the trash.

Having enchants and gems ready in your bags to immediately use the new item is a massive plus, and doesn't even cost you extra money since it will be used soon anyways.



[b][size=6]Loot distribution[/size][/b]

Main-spec > important off-specs > trials > off-spec > alts
DPS > healers > tanks

We distribute after what the guild and raid group will benefit the most from. There are many parameters involved, but in short we give more and earlier to those who perform best in the group. All will get loot, but those who can get more out of each stat will help the group more, and then make sure the rest will get loot faster too.



[b][size=6]Streaming while raiding[/size][/b]

Mute TeamSpeak/Mumble.
Hide guild chat.
Hide raid chat.



[b][size=6]/w'ing officers during raids[/size][/b]

We encourage everybody to think critically and constructively. We also welcome good suggestions.

During raids there is lots going on in the background that the members don't see or hear. The raid leader(s) can be extremely busy throughout the whole raid duration, and might not have time to /w about all and everything. One of the raid leader's main tasks is to make sure the raid goes as efficient as possible, so if you have good and important suggestions you can go on and /w. Otherwise try ask one of the other officers or wait until after raid. We can always do a fast meeting after raid with you and all the officers and listen to what you have to say, analyze, dissect, conclude, find a solution, and set it to life swiftly if it would work.

If you have some good ideas on new bosses we can discuss them on TS/Mumble when the first boss tries have calmed down.





[b][size=6]Very short summary[/size][/b]

All that is written here is something we all have been complaining about throughout our years of raiding.

We now write these as "rules" and "employment contract" so that we can finally get rid of those annoying issues.

For all who are raiding with their common sense intact are already covering most, if not all, that is written here.

All guilds who are trying to do serious raiding have all the same rules, but they aren't that often written down, and often lead to confusion about what is expected. We want to be more open and direct about what we want and have less unspoken rules that can be randomly broken, and you will have less to worry about.


We care very much for you all no matter what we ask for or what you say! We all just express it in different ways.

Greetings!

You have chosen to apply to Vin la Cvicek and have been /ginvited and accepted for trial. Before we go on and raid together there is something we want you to read and do first.





Your expectations to us

By accepting this /ginvite you have also accepted the following rules and statements:

Raiding with us is optional. There is no rule in the universe that says you HAVE TO raid with us. You are here because you want to.

But since we are a group of real people who spend real time and real energy on this we need some rules so this group effort goes more smoothly. If we don't live up to your expectations you are free to leave at any moment, even if passed trial. It's your choice.

The calendar is filled with future raids. Since we all like to plan ahead of time we accept or decline to what our schedule looks like. Having to decline a raid day happens. We all got some special events some times a year. If you find your IRL time doesn't strerch far enough to come raid for a certain day or week you decline the calendar events and tell the officers for how long. If you later find out this has to become permanent we have a slacker rank for just this purpose.

You can still be in the guild without having to raid. It's optional after all.



Our expectations to you

We recently migrated to this server to have an easier time recruiting and then finally get the progression we have planned for so long. We have done big changes within the guild to push us further towards our goal, and we will continue to make changes when we see they will give us an advantage. Now with recruitment we have lots of new ppl, and we all have to adjust to eachothers. So as you can see there is lots happening at once.

We are in essence recreating the guild but without losing our old values.

Because of this the guild will be changing and progressing in another rate in 2 months than it does today. What you see today won't be the case in the future. We will be constantly improving and trying out different ppl to see who fits progression better. How fast and how far we will get depends on what each of us are doing, and how hard each of us are pushing.

This is where you come into the picture.

When we are close to downing a new mythic boss there is so little extra that is needed from it to go from a wipe to a kill. If we wipe a whole day on a boss the officers then sit down and analyze what went wrong and what can be done better. If you happen to not do your best because "that other guy is slacking so I won't bother to push my max either" then it will look to us as you are a slacker too. We will end up replacing two instead of one.

Same goes for when we have farmed a tier for weeks and months and then get a new raid tier on our hands. We will pick those we know will perform well and consistently. Rest will get some fun too, but they have to wait until the bosses are on farm mode.

Anyone who makes drama will get the same treatment, but they might get it faster or even demoted. We do not want any kind of drama in this guild. Not even lootwhoring drama! We are gearing up the group so the group can progress further faster, and that means some will get more gear faster than others.

That's life.

The officers have a set rulebook for who gets loot in which order. If you don't agree you might not fit in with us.


Some last points:
  • Don't die > do everything right > good numbers >>>>> bad numbers
  • Perform average or better compared to the raid group to keep your raid spot, and continue to find ways to improve.
  • If there are more of your class+spec in the guild then only the best will be picked.
  • Class stacking might happen too.
  • We can help you out if you ask, but we can't help if you don't know what to ask for.
  • Treat the in-game calendar as your IRL work schedule. The consequences are the same.
  • Same goes for how you treat others.
  • Ask on TeamSpeak/Mumble if you need info/refreshment on specific fight elements.
  • If each and every one of us give a little extra to the group the group will grow pretty fast.
  • DPS-whoring on wrong targets at crucial moments will result in a kick if you don't improve. If you whore like that you single-handedly wipe the group. All by yourself. Gz on that achievement!
  • If you disagree with some decisions during raids you still do what you are told to. We can discuss it later if we are in combat. Maybe we were wrong. Maybe you were wrong. But for this group to function we need all to do their jobs, couse it's almost impossible to analyze what went wrong if everybody did what they randomly wanted to.
  • This guild care about solutions. All problems and "problems" will be solved in one way or the other. Or the third.



Raiding days+hours

TBD.

Mandatory addons

CalendarNotify

BigWigs Bossmods

But if someone use DBM there will always be compability problems around patch and upgrade days, and the raid as a whole wastes lots of time every time the DBM'ers have to fiddle with it.

fields.body:
The thread [url=http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topic/44/]"Introduction to trials"[/url] has been written and reviewed by the officers. It's closer to finished, but before we can call it done we want all the members to review it.



The function with this document is exactly what the title says. All new trials will have to read this and do what it says. But, it won't be counting for ONLY trials.

After we have read through it some times, discussed it, and done some changes, it will eventually be all our new "rulebook" aka "employee contract" aka whatever you wanna call it. So spend some time on it now so we can all agree on it later.

The estiamted time before it goes into effect is around start of june or something like that. At that point this feedback thread will be moved to the officer forum for storage, and the discussion is over, and we will have to boey what we all agreed on.



The reason for doing it like this is because we all have been bothered by most of these issues throughout our raiding career. Now that we have given ourselves a new start on a new server we also have to introduce some improvements. These improvements are made so that we won't waste eachother's time. They will ask for a little extra of your time, unless you are already doing them, but what you alone and us as a group will gain will be massive. It won't be a one-way giving. Remember that there are 19 others who are also giving, so in essence you are receiving 19 times more than you give. You'll notice the change in the group really fast when we all do this together.

We all hate that the negative parts that can happen during raids happen. We all wish they never happened. That's why we wanna spoonfeed new trials right away with what we don't wanna see happen in our guild and in our raids (while we also are not doing it ourselves).

At the same time it shouldn't be a new dictatorship of some sort, so wording has to be chosen with care without losing the meaning of the text.



Reply with whatever you have on your mind.

No opinion is wrong (for you).

The estiamted time before it goes into effect is around start of june or something like that. At that point this feedback thread will be moved to the officer forum for storage, and the discussion is over, and we will have to boey what we all agreed on.

[b][u]Application process:[/u][/b]

Create a new thread here:
[url=http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topics/2/]http://www.vinlacvicek.com/forum/topics/2/[/url]

(Alternatively we can do combined /w and TS meeting.)

Set the subject to:
"Application: yourname (yourspec yourclass)"

Copy/paste the rest of this post and fill in the blanks:


[code][b][size=5]About yourself[/size][/b]

Name:

Age:

Gender:

Country:



[b][size=5]Your computer[/size][/b]

System specifications:

FPS during general raiding:

FPS during raiding and heavy load (bloodlust+spam everything+shiny boss abilities):

Do you have and use a microphone?

Internet connection (use [url=http://www.speedtest.net/]speedtest.net[/url], pick Paris which is where the Draenor server is located, and paste the result-URL):

How often do you disconnect?

How often does your PC crash?



[b][size=5]Character information[/size][/b]

Character name:

Class:

Spec:

Amory link:

Off-spec (if any):

Alts worth mentioning:



[b][size=5]Raiding[/size][/b]

Raiding schedule and IRL (will our raiding schedule fit your real life?):

Previous expansion experience:

Mindset (describe your attitude on progress and farm raids):

Screenshot of your UI while raiding (use [url=http://imgur.com/]imgur[/url] or similar):

Which important addons and WAs do you use?

Which macros do you use?

Which keybinds do you use?

How do you check what your dps is like?

Where do you find new info about your class?

If you have geared alts; at which lvl can you play them?

Do you know anyone from the guild:



[b][size=5]Previous guilds[/size][/b]
(Which guilds and roles.)



[b][size=5]Anything else you wanna add?[/size][/b]

[/code]

fields.body:
[b]Guild master:[/b]
Rapiu

[b]Focus areas:[/b]
[list]
[*] Oversee the officer's work and performance.
[*] Ensure they have what they need and the time needed to do it.
[*] Responsible for initiating new goals, directions and methods, include all officers (and members in big changes) to find the best solution, and make sure the process goes well, as planned and that we reach our goal.
[*] Responsible for all social aspects of the guild.
[*] Assist any officer where and when needed.
[/list]



[b]Raid leader:[/b]
Frostmaster

[b]Focus areas:[/b]
[list]
[*] In general all that is raid related in the technical direction.
[*] Plan ahead of time and create a strategy on how to proceed with the order and rate of progression in new raid instances.
[*] Plan what will be done for each raid day.
[*] Efficient raids.
[*] Watch the raid during encounters, tell timers, do minor adjustments, etc.
[*] Responsible for directing and redirecting raid members on who get spots for each boss and who will do which task during the encounter.
[*] Responsible for assessing player skills and if they are adequate as a temporary or pemanent member, and to keep a continued discussion on this topic with the other officers.
[*] Cooperate with the healing leader.
[*] Tell the recruitment officer which class+spec is needed.
[/list]



[b]Healing leader:[/b]
Bishii

[b]Focus areas:[/b]
[list]
[*] Design and develop [url=http://www.vinlacvicek.com/]http://www.vinlacvicek.com/[/url]
[*] All related to healing and damage reduction in the techical direction.
[*] Plan ahead of time how many healers and which healer classes are needed for each boss.
[*] Plan ahead of time which cooldowns are needed where.
[*] Responsible for assessing healer player skills and if they are adequate as temporary or permanent member, and to keep a continued discussion on this topic with the other officers.
[*] Cooperate with the raid leader.
[*] Tell the recruitment officer which healer class+spec is needed.
[/list]



[b]Recruitment officer:[/b]
Gothikanemo
(Will be working to around 2100 until july.)

[b]Focus areas:[/b]
[list]
[*] Recieve a list of which classes+specs that we need to recruit.
[*] Spam trade chat with recruitment macro and redirect possible applicants to the website.
[*] Answer forum applications, investigate who the person is and accept for trial if made of the right quality.
[*] Guide new trials when they join and through the first raids.
[/list]



[b]Draenor expert:[/b]
Dotftw

[b]Focus areas:[/b]
[list]
[*] Draenor relations.
[*] Lootcouncil member.
[*] Recruitment.
[/list]





[b][u]On top of this:[/u][/b]
All officers are always discussing changes needed before decisions are made.
They are also helping eachothers during raids, etc, although each officer has the final word on their own area.
